statement.p: In the figure below, the angles that appear to be right angles are in fact right angles. Lengths in the figure are given in units of miles.

Image DescriptionA closed shape with five straight sides, with its interior shaded, where four of its five sides are either horizontal or vertical. Beginning at the top left corner and moving straight down, the path around the shape starts with a side that is labeled 88 miles, then moving to the right, a side is unlabeled, then moving diagonally up and right, a side is labeled 34 miles, then moving straight up, a side is labeled 72 miles, and finally moving to the left, a side is labeled 73 miles, connecting back to the original starting point at top left.
What is the perimeter of the shaded shape? Give your answer as a decimal number, and then choose the correct units from the dropdown menu.
